item.title: What's wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @_Haste1 #Haste
item.description:
@_Haste1 wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:12, topic:394996”][quote author=#Haste link=topic=492186.msg3599205#msg3599205 date=1305407076]
…

I’m not good client-sided, and you’re giving me an example.

Someone told me to put it under another int, and I got 100 errors… So I backed up the Java file and I still don’t know WHERE to put it.
[/quote]
I don’t think you pastebin’d the right file. The file you uploaded contained only cases whereas you’re example had an if statement.[/quote]
I uploaded ItemDef.Java

And the tutorial I used, told me to put it into ItemDef2 OR ItemDef, and I only got ItemDef.

item.title: What's wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote="#Haste, post:9, topic:394996"][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=492186.msg3599196#msg3599196 date=1305406674]
“unreachable statement”… Read it.

It means that statement is UNREACHABLE. Something above it is causing the method to exit before that statement can be reached.
[/quote]

Mh…[/quote]
Here’s an example

public void unreachableStatement(int i) { return; // Exit the method. // Everything below this line is unreachable. if(i == 32) { System.out.println("Unreachable lol"); // } }

Read full topic

item.title: What's wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @_Haste1 #Haste
item.description:
@_Haste1 wrote:

So it’d be

[code] case 13883:
if(i == 15701) { //Blue
itemDef.actions = new String[5];
itemDef.actions[1] = “Wear”;
itemDef.modelID = 52837; //drop model
itemDef.maleEquip1 = 52832; //male wield model
itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 52832; //femArmModel
itemDef.modelZoom = 2110;
itemDef.modelRotation1 = 591;
itemDef.modelRotation2 = 1034;
itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0;
itemDef.modelOffset2 = 0;
itemDef.aByte154 = -14;
itemDef.name = “Dark Bow”;
itemDef.description = “A Recolored Dark bow!”.getBytes();
}
break;
case 15702:

		if(i == 15702) { //Green

		}

break;

}
break;
case 15704:
